definition: frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Thank you for never being sarcastic The thing that baffles and bewilders a child.
sentences.chinese: 感谢您从不冷嘲热讽孩子眼中感到迷惑茫然的事情。

sentences.english: Finally, lampooned by his countrymen for his impotence , he was spurred into action.
sentences.chinese: 最终，国民冷嘲热讽他无能，他才被迫迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: And pessimism, sarcasm or silence becomes the dominant style of family communications.
sentences.chinese: 而悲观，冷嘲热讽或沉默则成为家庭沟通的主基调。

sentences.english: The Global Compact attracted cynicism from the start.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始，全球契约组织就饱受冷嘲热讽。

sentences.english: Wang Yung-ching is not intimidated by other people's cynicism.
sentences.chinese: 王永庆没有被别人的冷嘲热讽吓倒。

sentences.english: A sharp put-down was the only way to shut her up .
sentences.chinese: 对她冷嘲热讽是让她闭嘴的唯一方法。

sentences.english: He swung from mere indifference to outright scorn.
sentences.chinese: 一开始他还只是漠不关心，后来竟变得冷嘲热讽起来。

sentences.english: The financial markets are appropriately cynical about U.S. politics.
sentences.chinese: 金融市场恰如其分地对美国的政治冷嘲热讽。

sentences.english: Karkov was not cynical about those times either when he talked.
sentences.chinese: 卡可夫谈起往事时也没对那些日子冷嘲热讽。

sentences.english: Despite all the scorns he was poured on, he followed his own path.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他受到冷嘲热讽，他还是走自己的路。

sentences.english: You have given the world the best. But you may have satires and mockings in return.
sentences.chinese: 你给世界最好的，而换来的可能只是冷嘲热讽。

sentences.english: The cynical Eurocrat has seemingly been proved right.
sentences.chinese: 欧共体官员的冷嘲热讽似乎已经得到了验证。

definition: to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to hurl abuse/to deride/to call sb names
